title: How the nation's biggest Treasure Hunt unfolded
text:
Greg James hid four golden tickets across the UK, to give one lucky listener a pass to Radio 1’s Big Weekend 2020, the sold-out Glastonbury 50th anniversary AND Reading or Leeds Festival.

The catch? When one ticket was found, the others would be destroyed. That, and it would require some detective work to locate their whereabouts.

The first clue was four Radio 1 presenters had gone hiding across the UK. Huw Stephens was in Wales, Mollie King in England, Arielle Free in Scotland and Phil Taggart in Northern Ireland.

Each was within coughing distance of a Golden Ticket, and they were all hiding in a “park or green space.”

That narrowed it down, right? A quick Google suggests there’s around 27,000 parks in the UK.

A clue on Greg James' podcast also suggested each ticket was "on a seat".

Joggers ran past a ticket, cars whizzed by, but by 9am, nobody was any closer to stumbling upon the ultimate festival pass.
description: Greg James had the country searching for a Golden Ticket, and here's what happened
